common.desktopOnly: This UI is optimized for desktop while the product is early. Mobile support will be added as workflows mature.

create.title: New chat
create.subtitle: Pick a model, type your message, and send to begin.
create.heroSubtitle: Start with a message. You can refine model and settings anytime.
create.oauthRequired: This model provider requires a connected account.
create.memberDefaults: Members use organization default model settings.

executorGuide.title: Set up a BYON executor before your first chat
executorGuide.subtitleOwner: No worker node is online for this organization yet. Create a token and connect one here, or start an already paired node.
executorGuide.subtitleMember: No worker node is online for this organization yet. Ask an owner/admin to connect one or start an already paired node.
executorGuide.autoTokenCreated: Pairing token created automatically for this organization.
executorGuide.tokenUnavailable: No pairing token yet. Create one to continue.
executorGuide.checkStatus: I have connected it, check again
executorGuide.installerUnavailable: Installer metadata is unavailable. Open the Worker Nodes page for full setup options.
executorGuide.memberCannotPair: Your role cannot create pairing tokens. Ask an owner/admin to complete executor pairing.
executorGuide.blockComposerHint: No worker node is online yet. You can still create a chat now and pair a node before sending.
executorGuide.noExecutorErrorOwner: No worker node is online yet. Start an already paired node, or pair and connect a new one.
executorGuide.noExecutorErrorMember: No worker node is online yet. Ask an owner/admin to start a paired node or pair a new one.

actions.archivedReadonly: This conversation is archived. Restore it before sending.

chat.title: Chat
chat.subtitle: Messages are persisted as events.
chat.empty: No events yet. Send a message to begin.
chat.placeholder: Ask the agent to do something...
chat.shortcutHint: Enter to send, Shift+Enter for newline.

commandPalette.title: Search
commandPalette.description: Search commands and navigate within the app.

models.title: Models
models.subtitle: Search and select a model. Use curated suggestions or type a custom model ID.
models.manageHint: Hide models you never use. Hidden models won't appear in the picker.
models.catalogUnavailable: Model catalog unavailable. You can still type a model ID manually.

connections.title: Model Connections
connections.subtitle: Connect each engine with the right method before running chats and workflows.
connections.primarySubtitle: This default is used across chat, workflows, and toolset generation.
connections.oauthRequired: This provider requires a connected OAuth account.
connections.providersSubtitle: Connect, rotate, or disconnect provider accounts without exposing internal implementation details.
connections.byonOnlyDescription: Sessions and workflows run only on BYON executors. Install CLI and sign in on each executor host.

matrix.title: Connection matrix
matrix.subtitle: Official methods vs currently supported runtime paths in Vespid.

connections.apiKeyGroupDescription: Use API keys for providers that support direct key authentication.
connections.oauthGroupDescription: Authorize providers that require OAuth or device flow.
connections.testPassed: API key verified. You can save now.
connections.testRequired: Please test this key before saving.
connections.apiKeyDialogDescription: Test the key first, then save only when verification succeeds.
connections.oauthDialogDescription: Authorize with provider account and return to this page to finish connection.
connections.oauthOpened: Verification page opened in a new tab.

opencode.apiKeyModeNote: Use this when Vespid should inject one org-level API key into OpenCode runtime.
opencode.executorManagedNote: Use this when each executor host is configured with OpenCode provider profile or environment variables.
opencode.runtimeNoCustody: Configured on each executor host; control plane does not store those credentials.

wizard.heroTitle: Set up model connections in 3 steps
wizard.heroSubtitle: Chats and workflows always execute on BYON executors. Choose engine, configure auth path, then verify.

path.subtitle: Pick the credential source for this engine.
path.oauthDescription: Sign in on each executor host with CLI login. Best default for teams.
path.apiKeyDescription: Use org-managed API key and optional enterprise base URL.

selectEngine.title: Step 1 · Select engine and path
selectEngine.desc: Choose the target engine and recommended connection path.

configure.title: Step 2 · Configure credentials
configure.desc: Set API key/base URL or follow executor-side OAuth login.

verify.title: Step 3 · Verify and finish
verify.desc: Check executor readiness, save, and move to next engine.

wizard.verifySubtitle: Validation happens on executor hosts, not in the browser.
wizard.baseUrlExecutorScoped: Base URL is applied on executor hosts when API key mode is active.
wizard.executorOauthOnly: OAuth verification status is derived from executor heartbeat and auth probe.
wizard.oauthUsesExecutor: Current path uses executor-side account login. No key is stored in control plane.
wizard.apiKeyUsesExecutor: Current path injects org-managed API key at runtime on executor hosts.
wizard.opencodeTemplateSubtitle: Store provider JSON on each executor host. Control plane keeps only mode selection.

connections.runtimeSubtitle: Override base URL and API kind for OpenAI-like/custom endpoints.

apiUnreachable.title: API unreachable
apiUnreachable.description: Cannot reach the control plane API at {base}. Start it locally or set NEXT_PUBLIC_API_BASE.

authRequired.title: Session expired or access denied
authRequired.description: Sign in again to continue, then refresh this page.

org.subtitle: Set your active organization before using app features.
org.createDescription: Creates an org and automatically sets it as active.

auth.title: Sign in
auth.subtitle: Sign in to get a personal workspace and start building workflows.
auth.passwordLoginDescription: Use your email and password to sign in or create an account.
auth.loggedOutDescription: You have been signed out. Sign in again to continue.

workflows.title: Workflows
workflows.subtitle: Build and run automations after your chat flow is ready.

fields.githubSecretPlaceholder: Select a GitHub connection from Model Connections.
fields.previewHint: This is the DSL v2 payload that will be saved.

workflows.openByIdDescription: Open an existing workflow by ID, or jump to a recent one (stored locally).

tips.title: Tips
tips.subtitle: Make the cockpit feel fast.
tips.body: Use compact density for runs, and switch to dark theme for long debugging sessions.

errors.githubSecretRequired: Connect GitHub before enabling GitHub tools.
errors.vertexSecretRequired: Vertex requires a connected OAuth account.

createDisabledReasons.githubSecret: A GitHub connection is required when GitHub tools are enabled.
createDisabledReasons.providerSecret: Selected provider requires a connected account.

templates.title: Templates
templates.description: Apply a template to prefill the builder, then adjust and create.

github-issue-triage.name: GitHub issue triage
github-issue-triage.description: Triage incoming issues, then draft and execute the next action.

http-to-agent.name: Intake normalization
http-to-agent.description: Normalize inbound payloads and prepare a clear automation handoff.

agent-shell.name: Agent shell runner
agent-shell.description: Run shell diagnostics through the agent and summarize outcomes.

sheet.title: Workflow details
sheet.historyEmpty: No revision history yet. Publish to create immutable revisions.

detail.queueUnavailable: Queue unavailable. Ensure Redis is running.
detail.invalidJson: Run input must be valid JSON.

agents.title: Worker Nodes
agents.subtitle: Remote worker nodes paired to this organization.
agents.noAgentsDescription: Create a pairing token to connect a worker node.
agents.pairingHint: Tokens are displayed only once. They expire in 15 minutes.

pairingSteps.step2: 2. Run the connect command with the token
pairingSteps.step3: 3. Refresh this page and verify the worker node is online

installer.title: Connector program
installer.subtitle: Use npm to run the worker-node CLI and connect this machine.
installer.fallbackDescription: Installer metadata is unavailable right now. Please retry shortly or open the setup guide.
installer.fallbackUsingDefaults: Installer metadata is unavailable. Using default npm commands.
installer.tokenMissing: Create a pairing token to get a copy-ready connect command.
installer.tokenExpired: The pairing token has expired. Create a new token before connecting.

toolsets.title: Toolsets
toolsets.subtitle: Reusable MCP servers and Agent Skills bundles for agent.run (node execution).
toolsets.name: Name
toolsets.accessDeniedDescription: Toolsets can be managed by org owners and admins.

ai.title: Generate toolset with AI
ai.subtitle: Create a draft toolset by describing what you need, then review and edit before saving.
ai.guardrail: Do not paste credentials. Use $'{'ENV:...'}' placeholders and manage connections in Model Connections.
ai.noSecretsHint: No matching model connection found for this provider. Connect it in Model Connections first.

validation.mcpCommandRequired: Command is required for stdio transport.
validation.mcpUrlRequired: URL is required for http transport.
validation.skillIdNameRequired: Skill id and name are required.

toolsets.emptyLibraryDescription: Create a toolset to reuse MCP and Agent Skills.
toolsets.emptyGalleryDescription: Publish a toolset from the library to make it appear here.

secrets.title: Secrets
secrets.warning: Secret values are never shown again after creation.
secrets.name: Name

presets.title: LLM presets (BYOK)
presets.subtitle: Store your provider API keys as encrypted org secrets. Values are never shown again after saving.

modelDefaults.title: Model defaults
modelDefaults.subtitle: Org-level defaults used to prefill sessions and workflows so you don't configure models repeatedly.

vertex.title: Advanced: Vertex AI (OAuth)
vertex.subtitle: Connect Google Cloud via OAuth (offline). Optional for teams using Vertex.

secrets.modelConnectionsDescription: Use Model Connections for normal setup and authorization flows.

hero.title: Orchestrate workflows, worker nodes, and execution at enterprise scale.
hero.subtitle: Vespid turns workflow ideas into production automation with secure multi-tenant isolation, auditable runs, and optional node execution.

logos.title: Trusted by teams building automation at scale
logos.subtitle: Industry-ready patterns: isolation, auditability, and safe execution.

quickstart.title: From zero to first run in minutes
quickstart.subtitle: Sign in to get a personal workspace and start building workflows.

signIn.title: Sign in
signIn.description: OAuth sign-in creates a personal workspace automatically.

pick.title: Pick a workflow
pick.description: Start from a template, then refine nodes and connectors.

run.title: Run + observe
run.description: Queued execution with events, retries, and a timeline you can audit.

artifact.title: Artifact preview
artifact.subtitle: What you ship is what you can audit.
artifact.callout: No API key required to try. BYON is supported when you are ready.

features.title: Everything required to run workflows in production
features.subtitle: From governance to execution, Vespid delivers the orchestration layer your teams can trust.

orgIsolation.title: Org-scoped isolation
orgIsolation.description: Strict tenant boundaries with PostgreSQL RLS and scoped credentials.

workflowDsl.title: Workflow DSL v2
workflowDsl.description: Model workflow graphs that are versioned, testable, and production-safe.

queueFirst.title: Queue-first execution
queueFirst.description: Async runs with retries, backoff, and deterministic state transitions.

nodeBrowser.title: Node & browser execution
nodeBrowser.description: Route sensitive steps to worker nodes or browser sessions on demand.

auditReady.title: Audit-ready events
auditReady.description: Every run and node emits immutable events for compliance teams.

connectors.title: Extensible connectors
connectors.description: Connectors for business tools with encrypted secret storage.

design.title: Design workflows
design.description: Compose workflow reasoning, connectors, and runtime rules in a visual DSL.

publish.title: Publish & enqueue
publish.description: Move from draft to production with queue-backed runs and retries.

observe.title: Observe runs & optimize
observe.description: Inspect every node event, diagnose failures, and iterate safely.

useCases.title: Workflow automation that moves real operations
useCases.subtitle: Build repeatable automation across teams without rewriting infrastructure.

onboarding.title: Customer onboarding automation
onboarding.description: Turn intake, verification, and follow-up into a single orchestrated run.

compliance.title: Compliance evidence collection
compliance.description: Gather records, approvals, and audit trails without manual chasing.

revenueOps.title: Revenue ops enrichment
revenueOps.description: Sync CRM updates and enrich pipeline data automatically.

reconciliation.title: Back-office reconciliation
reconciliation.description: Match data across systems and surface exceptions instantly.

supportRouting.title: Support escalation routing
supportRouting.description: Detect risk signals and route cases to the right operators.

postmortems.title: Incident postmortems
postmortems.description: Collect signals, timelines, and actions into a standardized report.

logistics.title: Global logistics cut manual ops by 42%
logistics.description: Automated routing, booking, and exception handling across three regions.

fintech.title: Fintech reduced workflow failures by 68%
fintech.description: Queue-backed retries and observability cut incident rework drastically.

retail.title: Retail team shipped 12 workflow automations in 30 days
retail.description: Reusable templates and connectors sped up cross-functional automation.

pricing.title: Pricing built for orchestration at scale
pricing.subtitle: Start small, upgrade when you need deeper governance and node execution.
pricing.footerNote: Self-hosted friendly. Contact us for enterprise support.

data.question: Do you store customer data?
data.answer: Only the workflow data required for execution, protected by tenant isolation and encrypted secrets.

infra.question: Can we use our own infrastructure?
infra.answer: Yes. Use worker nodes and the gateway to execute sensitive workloads inside your network.

queue.question: What happens if the queue is down?
queue.answer: Runs fail fast with a 503 to avoid dirty queued states. Retry once the queue is healthy.

start.question: How do we start?
start.answer: Create an account, build a workflow, and publish it to run your first automation.

locale.question: Do you support zh-CN?
locale.answer: Yes, the product ships with zh-CN localization.

cta.title: Ready to orchestrate your first workflow?
cta.subtitle: Give your teams the execution backbone they need to ship reliable automation.

channels.title: Channels
channels.subtitle: Connect and manage your messaging channels.

create.title: Create channel account
create.subtitle: Create one channel account to start receiving and sending messages.

security.groupMentionHint: When enabled, group messages must mention the bot before routing.

accounts.title: Channel accounts
accounts.subtitle: All accounts in the active organization.

pairing.title: Pairing requests
pairing.subtitle: Approve or reject pending DM pairing requests.

detail.title: Channel account
detail.subtitle: Configure runtime security, connection status, and operational actions.
detail.configSubtitle: Update channel policies and account metadata.
detail.connectionSubtitle: Use connected integrations to authenticate this channel account.
detail.testSendSubtitle: Send a test outbound message via gateway channel runtime.
detail.allowlistSubtitle: Manage sender/group/conversation allowlist entries used by security gating.

errors.allowlistRequired: Allowlist scope and subject are required.
errors.testSendRequired: Conversation ID and message text are required.
